intro: Leiothrix plantago, commonly known as the silverleaf plantain, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features basal rosettes of broad, silver-veined leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and ability to attract pollinators.
